content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code for your request:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]" => "_")
end
```
This function takes a string `col` as input and returns a new string where the column name is cleaned up according to your specifications. The `replace()` function replaces all occurrences of the pattern (spaces or hyphens) with an underscore, while `lowercase()` converts the string to lower case, and `strip()` removes any leading or trailing whitespaces.
